[[File:Front radiograph of the lumbar spine with syndesmophytosis.jpg|vignette|Front radiograph of the lumbar spine with syndesmophytosis]]
[[File:Radiographie de profil du rachis lombaire.jpg|vignette|Radiographie du rachis lombaire avec syndesmophytose]]Syndesmophytes are thin, vertical bony structures between two vertebrae.

question.question: In the radiography of the spine, how are syndesmophytes typically characterized?
question.option_a: As horizontal bony bridges connecting vertebrae
question.option_b: As thin, vertical bony structures between two vertebrae
question.option_c: As large, irregular bony growths on the vertebral bodies
question.option_d: As soft tissue swellings adjacent to the vertebral column
